subject: Ethics
title: Famous Whistleblowers and Their Fates
description: A fast breakdown of Famous Whistleblowers and Their Fates for builders.

hook.text: Sherron Watkins warned Enron's CEO about fraud. She was sidelined. He went to prison. She lost her career.

buildup.text: Whistleblowers expose wrongdoing from inside organizationsâ€”fraud, safety violations, corruption.

discovery.text: Edward Snowden revealed NSA mass surveillance. Daniel Ellsberg leaked the Pentagon Papers. Both changed history.

twist.text: Almost every famous whistleblower paid a devastating personal priceâ€”exile, firing, lawsuits, or social isolation.

climax.text: Society celebrates whistleblowers after the fact but punishes them in real time. The pattern never changes.

punchline.text: Heroes in the history books. Pariahs in the break room.

quiz.question: What typically happens to whistleblowers in the short term?
options: They receive immediate promotions and praise
They face retaliation, job loss, and social isolation
